You're already on the right track by using coupons! Here are some additional tips to help you optimize your meal planning and grocery shopping:

1. **Plan your meals around sales**: Check the weekly ads for your local stores and plan your meals around the items that are on sale. This will help you save money on the items you need and reduce food waste.
2. **Stock up on non-perishables**: Since you mentioned you buy similar items every week, consider stocking up on non-perishable staples like rice, pasta, and canned goods when they're at their lowest price. This will help you save money in the long run and reduce your weekly grocery bill.
3. **Buy in bulk**: Purchasing items like rice, pasta, and canned goods in bulk can often be cheaper than buying smaller quantities. Just make sure you have enough storage space and that the items won't expire before you can use them.
4. **Shop at discount stores**: Consider shopping at discount stores or dollar stores for non-perishable items. They often offer lower prices than traditional grocery stores.
5. **Use cashback apps**: Apps like Ibotta and Fetch Rewards offer cashback on certain grocery items. You can also use apps like Checkout 51 and RetailMeNot to find digital coupons and discounts.
6. **Shop in season**: Produce that's in season is often cheaper than out-of-season produce. You can also find seasonal produce at farmer's markets or through a community-supported agriculture (CSA) program.
7. **Avoid processed and pre-packaged foods**: Processed and pre-packaged foods tend to be more expensive than whole ingredients. Opt for fresh fruits and vegetables, and cook meals from scratch to save money.
8. **Use unit prices**: When comparing prices between different brands or sizes of an item, check the unit price (price per ounce or pound) to make sure you're getting the best deal.
9. **Shop with a list**: Sticking to your list can help you avoid impulse purchases and stay on track with your meal plan.
10. **Consider shopping at Aldi or Lidl**: These discount grocery stores offer affordable prices on staples like rice, pasta, and canned goods.

Regarding your specific staples, here are some tips:

* **Rice**: Look for sales on bulk rice or opt for store-brand rice, which is often cheaper than name-brand rice.
* **Pasta**: Stock up on pasta when it's on sale, and consider buying in bulk. You can also opt for store-brand pasta or buy in bulk from a warehouse club.
* **Canned tomatoes**: Look for sales on canned tomatoes or stock up when they're at their lowest price. You can also consider buying in bulk or purchasing crushed or diced tomatoes, which are often cheaper than whole canned tomatoes.

By implementing these strategies, you can save money on your weekly grocery bill and make the most of your 20% off coupon!
